intro: Psychotria leptothyrsa var. defretesiana, commonly known as the Red-veined Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking red veins on its dark green leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
